subject: Productivity
title: Second-Order Thinking
description: A fast breakdown of Second-Order Thinking for builders.

hook.text: A city builds more roads to reduce traffic. More people drive. Traffic gets worse. Second-order effects.

buildup.text: First-order thinking asks: what happens next? Second-order asks: and then what happens after that?

discovery.text: Howard Marks calls this the mark of a superior thinker: going beyond the obvious first reaction.

twist.text: Most policy failures come from ignoring second-order effects. The cure often creates the next disease.

climax.text: Training yourself to ask and then what three times reveals consequences invisible to first-order minds.

punchline.text: First-order thinkers react. Second-order thinkers anticipate.

quiz.question: What does second-order thinking involve?
options: Only thinking about the immediate next step
